intro: Sarcodraba karr-aikensis var. major, commonly known as the Karr-aikensis sarcodraba, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its robust, upright stems and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
